questions.question_text: What are the key steps for importing asset data? (Choose three.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BDE
Answer:
 B. Run transform map
 D. Create transform map
 E. Load data

Explanation: procedure
 1. Navigate to All > Customer Service > Administration > Guided Setup and click Get Started
 2. In the Foundation Data category, click Get Started and then click Import Assets.
 3. Upload data from an external data source into an import set. (e.)
 4. Create a transform map. (d.)
 5. Execute the transform map to transfer the data. (b.)
 6. Verify that the data records are imported into the target table. (i just read the import log)

Source: https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/vancouver-customer-service-management/page/product/customer-service-management/task/import-csm-assets.html

Selected Answer: BDE
B, D, E is the correct answer

Selected Answer: BDE
Upload data from an external data source into an import set.
Create a transform map.
Execute the transform map to transfer the data.
https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/vancouver-customer-service-management/page/product/customer-service-management/task/import-csm-assets.html

Selected Answer: BDE
1- Load data: Data can be loaded from a spreadsheet or from a connection with a data source into an import set table.

2- Create transform map: From here, you identify how the information maps from the loaded data to the table or tables to which you want to add the imported data. Once you have your transform maps created, you can load the data and then transform.

3- Run transform: With the transform map completed, you run the transformation. This places the data in the appropriate target tables with any adjustments identified in the transform map.

questions.question_text: What must exist before a consumable can be consumed? (Choose three.)

discussion.content: Consumables already have a model category as "Consumables" so D is unnecessary but because they are asking 3 answers - BDE

Selected Answer: BDE
B. A model record
D. A model category record
E. A consumable record

Selected Answer: BDE
bde are correct

Selected Answer: C
188 of Vancouver book

Selected Answer: C
C
When you create a transfer order line, based on the model category specified in the asset, a transfer order line task is automatically created. Transfer order line tasks are created to move transfer order lines from one stage to the other. 
https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/vancouver-it-service-management/page/product/asset-management/concept/transfer-orders-asset.html
C is correct p186 tokyo book

choices.C: A transfer order line task is automatically created to move the transfer order line from one stage to another
choices.D: A transfer order line task is automatically created to validate enough stock exists
choices.E: The asset(s) listed in the transfer order line are automatically readied for shipment
choices.B: The transfer order line is automatically placed in a state of Ready for fulfilment
choices.A: The asset(s) listed in the transfer order line are automatically transferred to the new stockroom

questions.question_text: When using the HAM application, what happens when you create a new transfer order line on a transfer order?
Which ServiceNow Mobile app provides end users visibility to their assigned hardware and consumable assets?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B
ServiceNow Mobile app
Use the ServiceNow Mobile app to view the assets that are assigned to you, to report any issues with your assets, and to remotely receive new assets. Create incidents to report any issues with your assets to your IT department.
https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/vancouver-it-asset-management/page/administer/mobile-my-asset/concept/mobile-my-asset.html

Selected Answer: B
NOW Mobile app: Provides all employees visibility to your assigned hardware and consumable assets.
